titles.title: CITA Transparency Act of 2005
CITA Transparency Act of 2005

To prohibit the application of the foreign affairs exemption to the rule making requirements under the Administrative Procedure Act with respect to actions of the Committee for the Implementation of Textile Agreements.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.summary: CITA Transparency Act of 2005 - Declares that the Committee for the Implementation of Textile Agreements (CITA) shall not invoke the foreign affairs exemption from notice-and-comment requirements of the Administrative Procedure Act with respect to any of its actions related to textile trade.
